bibl.title: Sam Gum v. Henry M. White. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court, Western District, Northern Division.
UNITED STATES -vs- NY YAM, also known as SAM GUM.

It appearing to this Honorable Court upon the motion and petition of John J. Sullivan, attorney for defendant, that the said defendant died in Alaska, on the 10th day of March, 1922, and it further appearing that the United States Attorney has the said petition and in open court has admitted that this fact is correct and the court being fuly advised in the premises does hereby,

ORDER, ADJUDGE and DECREE, that the said Writ of Habeas Corpus be dismissed and an entry made on the records of this court that the defendant is dead and that his boundsment be exonerated and the Liberyt Bonds in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) deposited in the court for his appearance be returned to the person depositing same.
DONE in open Court this 29 day of March, 1922.
being first duly sworn, on oath says: that he is in the above entitled action; that he has read the foregoing knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true
Subscribed and sworn to before me this day of , 19
Notary Public in and for the States of Washington, residing at Seattle, Washington.
In the United States District Court of the Western District of Washington,
Ny Yam, also known as Sam Gum.
Filed in the United States District Court
